comments:
To reproduce:
Open Palette view in Java perspective
Create a (Swing JFrame) Java Visual Class + keep the editor open
Exit Eclipse + restart
The Palette displays an error:
  "An error has occurred when creating this view"

Workaround:
Close the Palette view; close the Visual Editor(s); reopen the editor

It doesn't show here because the actual exception is a saveState which results
in this error here too.

The saveState is trying to use the palette root, but we don't have a palette
root yet because the editor is not fully up yet.

This is a big problem if you have a palette view visible and you closed with an
open editor. When you restart the workspace it fails. The palette view never
fills during the session then.

The problem isn't the disposed widget in the first comment, the problem is the
saveState. It fails because there is no palette root yet (like the palette root
problems). Though I don't know why it is trying to do a saveState during window
creation.

It should be simple to add a null check to get around this problem.  I'll also 
test out and see what other problems can occur if the palette root is not set 
yet.

However, the other, more important problem here is why is saveState() being 
invoked in setExternalViewer().  That will only happen if the palette inside 
the editor is not null.  I traced down the problem: FlyoutPaletteComposite, in 
its constructor, uses Page.findView(ID) to determine whether the PaletteView 
is visible or not.  However, when the workbench is coming up, since there is 
no active perspective, it cannot find the view and thinks that it's not 
visible.  So, it creates one inside the editor.  Later, when the view creates 
the PalettePage, FlyoutComposite tries to copy the state from the in-editor 
palette to the in-view palette.  If I fix this problem, it will also fix the 
NPE error (since saveState() will not be invoked anymore).  However, just to 
be on the safe side, I will also add the null check to PaletteViewer.

I have opened another defect to track the problem of the palette being 
unnecessarily created in the editor first: Bug# 70482

So, this bug is only tracking the NPEs encountered when the palette's root is 
null.  Part of this problem has already been addressed by Bug# 68113.

Apart from the NPE mentioned above (in PaletteViewer#saveState(IMemento)), I 
found another one when a screen reader is on and focus is given to the 
PaletteView.  DomainEventDispatcher.EditPartAccessibilityDispatcher#get(int) 
tries to get the AccessibleEditPart from the contents.  I think it should be 
safe to add a null-check at that point as well.  Randy, can you think of any 
other repercussions of making this change?

I'll also update the Javadoc for PaletteViewer#getContents() to warn about the 
possibility of contents being null.
Fixed.  Changes have been released to HEAD and R30_Maintenance streams.
*** Bug 74843 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
